comment.author: 24469639@N00
comment._content: Hi, I hope it's OK, I have featured this image in a discussion aimed at trying to find the oldest photographs on Flickr - see www.flickr.com/groups/150-years-old/discuss/7215761992735...

comment.author: 24469639@N00
comment._content: thanks. So, how confident are you on the date of this one - in the title you simply say 1840s, in the description and metadata it puts it around 1840 itself?

comment.author: 11334970@N05
comment._content: The Royal Naval Hospital in Greenwich closed in 1869 allowing the picture to be dated before this time. Further accompanying information allows the image to be dated to the beginning of the 1840s but with no specific date.

I can't believe how black the Queen's House looks in the 1840s image.
I've only ever seen it shining white.
